title: Parasite
description: All unemployed, Ki-taek’s family takes peculiar interest in the wealthy and glamorous Parks for their livelihood until they get entangled in an unexpected incident.

reviews.review:
Update: 
Now in video form
There is a house on a hill, and there are people in it. And they're nice, but not really. There is a garden, and there they get a lot of sunlight. And it is nice, and they get to sleep there sometimes.
There is a house underground, and there are people in it. And they're the first to tell you that they're not very nice: they're con-men, grifters, forgers and imposters. They sit among stink…

call me by your name’s cum peach walked so parasite’s killer peach could run
Our expectations were high but HOLY FUCK
a question to people who rate this 4.5: what more do you want literally what more do you want
The tent won’t leak. It’s from America.

One detail I noticed this time around is that Min and Mr. Park both react the same way to being asked if they like or love the people that they're romantically involved with– by laughing. And in Mr. Park's case, giving a sarcastic answer that undercuts his saying 'yes'. Min and Mr. Park are both seen as powerful figures deserving of respect, and the way they dismissively respond to an earnest question about whether they truly care for the people…

The bloody napkin scene....top 3 scenes of all time. Hands down.
crazy rich asians walked, so that they could get stabbed in parasite
maybe the real parasite... was the friends we made along the way

A garden party.
A basement.
A stone.
A cake.
A knife.
A seizure.
A car-key.
A sausage skewer.
A smell.
A murder.
The most thrilling scene in years.
